subject: RE: [junit] RE: One test class per class (was Testing multiple interfaces?)
msgSnippet: ... I still don t get that scaling thing. ... It also gives you some compile time safety that you didn t misspelled a category. Do annotations give you that,
messageBody:
> Indeed, you specify those with annotations:
>
> @Test(groups = { "check-in", "functional", "database" }) public void
> testInsertion() { // note that the method doesn't really need to
> start with "test" }
>
> As I said earlier, using marker interfaces to achieve this
> goal is a stopgap measure that doesn't scale very well

I still don't get that scaling thing.

> (and
> also makes your classes implement all kinds of empty
> interfaces, which I personally don't find very clean, but I'm
> a bit of a purist in this regard :-)).

It also gives you some compile time safety that you didn't misspelled a
category. Do annotations give you that, too? (No criticism implied, I'm just
curious.)

Cheers, Ilja
